    The Iron Yard…so far

    May 19 · 2015

    Two weeks into the Iron Yard front-end engineering course, and the most surprising thing is how much about javascript is not able to be taught. I thought we would be sitting through hours of lecture, taking copious amounts of notes, and praying to learn by osmosis. But…the fact of the matter is that learning HTML, CSS and javascript seems to require learning by doing. The only way you’re going to get it is by practicing. Practice makes perfect. The most frustrating aspect so far is, ironically, the most satisfying: when you look at the homework assignment and your heart sinks because you have no clue how to even begin answering the first question, it makes it that much more gratifying when you finally do figure something out all on your own. So far, it’s been a tumultuous series of highs and lows.
